It Time To Move From dbt to SQLMesh?","Are dbt shortcomings painful enough to migrate to a new SQL transformation framework such as SQLMesh? Here's my take.","2024-02-28T18:00:00.000Z","Solutions",{"name":3049,"image":3050},"Benoit Pimpaud","bpimpaud","/blogs/2024-02-28-dbt-or-sqlmesh.png",{"type":18,"children":3053,"toc":5098},[3054,3068,3073,3078,3083,3088,3094,3115,3120,3173,3178,3192,3197,3202,3207,3213,3235,3240,3278,3291,3298,3303,3311,3313,3825,3838,3844,3866,3871,3885,3908,3914,3919,3999,4011,4016,4022,4053,4560,4568,4574,4579,5024,5037,5043,5048,5053,5058,5071,5094],{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3055,"children":3056},{},[3057,3059,3066],{"type":26,"value":3058},"Conversations around the ",{"type":21,"tag":29,"props":3060,"children":3063},{"href":3061,"rel":3062},"https://twitter.com/mattturck/status/1761436014122332187",[33],[3064],{"type":26,"value":3065},"Analytics Stack",{"type":26,"value":3067}," often revolve around the assumption that everyone is using the Extract, Load, Transform (ELT) approach, with the transformation (T) happening within a data warehouse using SQL. These discussions quickly shift towards the use of dbt as the go-to tool for this process.",{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3069,"children":3070},{},[3071],{"type":26,"value":3072},"Tools such as dbt and SQLMesh allow for such transformations to happen directly within a cloud data warehouse.",{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3074,"children":3075},{},[3076],{"type":26,"value":3077},"Before dbt, most data engineers maintained hand-made SQL templating engines to operate queries on their data warehouse. dbt has emerged as a standard to help avoid reinventing the wheel and has built a wonderful community around it.",{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3079,"children":3080},{},[3081],{"type":26,"value":3082},"With usage growing, some users started to complain about dbt shortcomings. New tools like SQLMesh started to emerge to address these challenges.",{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3084,"children":3085},{},[3086],{"type":26,"value":3087},"In this blog post, we'll delve into dbt and SQLMesh frameworks and how they need an orchestration engine to really shine.",{"type":21,"tag":68,"props":3089,"children":3091},{"id":3090},"the-shortcomings-of-dbt-core-why-many-practitioners-consider-alternatives",[3092],{"type":26,"value":3093},"The shortcomings of dbt core: why many practitioners consider alternatives",{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3095,"children":3096},{},[3097,3104,3106,3113],{"type":21,"tag":29,"props":3098,"children":3101},{"href":3099,"rel":3100},"https://www.getdbt.com/",[33],[3102],{"type":26,"value":3103},"dbt",{"type":26,"value":3105}," is the go-to solution for anything regarding transformation and data modeling with SQL nowadays. Some of the largest companies rely on dbt, and dbt ",{"type":21,"tag":29,"props":3107,"children":3110},{"href":3108,"rel":3109},"https://www.getdbt.com/blog/new-dbt-cloud-features-announced-at-coalesce-2023",[33],[3111],{"type":26,"value":3112},"can scale quite well",{"type":26,"value":3114},", and has a great community.",{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3116,"children":3117},{},[3118],{"type":26,"value":3119},"Still, here are some common complaints raised by the dbt community:",{"type":21,"tag":140,"props":3121,"children":3122},{},[3123,3135,3140,3145,3150],{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3124,"children":3125},{},[3126,3133],{"type":21,"tag":29,"props":3127,"children":3130},{"href":3128,"rel":3129},"https://www.reddit.com/r/dataengineering/comments/zamewl/whats_wrong_with_dbt/",[33],[3131],{"type":26,"value":3132},"Users are wondering",{"type":26,"value":3134}," why they need to explicitly use refs to declare dependencies between models. Other solutions often parse the SQL queries to infer the DAG of dependencies directly.",{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3136,"children":3137},{},[3138],{"type":26,"value":3139},"Some users are not fond of using YAML to define the model's schema as it leads to an additional user burden without tackling the root cause of data quality issues. Columns or types often change on purpose, and a failed build due to an outdated YAML schema can lead to frustration.",{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3141,"children":3142},{},[3143],{"type":26,"value":3144},"While incremental models in dbt efficiently process new or updated data, backfilling only specific time range intervals can become challenging when using the \"most recent records\" approach.",{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3146,"children":3147},{},[3148],{"type":26,"value":3149},"Thousands of lines of SQL paired with Jinja macros can easily become difficult to maintain especially with complex business logic.",{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3151,"children":3152},{},[3153,3155,3162,3164,3171],{"type":26,"value":3154},"Scaling across multiple projects is difficult: having too many dbt projects in a single repository is often hard to manage. You often need to split your hundreds (if not thousands) of models built by different teams and projects. However, cross-project references are not possible in dbt Core. It has been discussed in previous ",{"type":21,"tag":29,"props":3156,"children":3159},{"href":3157,"rel":3158},"https://github.com/dbt-labs/dbt-core/blob/main/docs/roadmap/2022-08-back-for-more.md",[33],[3160],{"type":26,"value":3161},"roadmap discussions",{"type":26,"value":3163},", but the final decisions have been to move it into ",{"type":21,"tag":29,"props":3165,"children":3168},{"href":3166,"rel":3167},"https://www.getdbt.com/product/dbt-mesh",[33],[3169],{"type":26,"value":3170},"dbt Mesh",{"type":26,"value":3172},", which is part of the commercial dbt Cloud offering.",{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3174,"children":3175},{},[3176],{"type":26,"value":3177},"The main interface to interact with dbt is the CLI, optionally generating a static documentation website. The major shift from dbt is that SQLMesh emphasizes ",{"type":21,"tag":29,"props":3228,"children":3231},{"href":3229,"rel":3230},"https://kestra.io/blogs/2024-02-06-gitops",[33],[3232],{"type":26,"value":3233},"GitOps",{"type":26,"value":623},{"type":21,"tag":22,"props":3236,"children":3237},{},[3238],{"type":26,"value":3239},"SQLMesh introduces key improvements for managing SQL queries:",{"type":21,"tag":140,"props":3241,"children":3242},{},[3243,3248,3253,3258,3263,3268,3273],{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3244,"children":3245},{},[3246],{"type":26,"value":3247},"SQLMesh can infer query dependencies",{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3249,"children":3250},{},[3251],{"type":26,"value":3252},"SQLMesh facilitates the identification of all downstream consumers of a specific model, along with the impact of changes (breaking or non-breaking) on each consumer, enabling a smooth migration process.",{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3254,"children":3255},{},[3256],{"type":26,"value":3257},"SQLMesh leverages an \"intervals approach\" for incremental by-time models. This approach encourages reasoning about the code without requiring deep dives into individual macro implementations. The clear separation of Python and SQL source files contributes to a clean codebase, while Python's inherent modularity further promotes well-organized implementation.",{"type":21,"tag":144,"props":3264,"children":3265},{},[3266],{"type":26,"value":3267},"SQLMesh allows the creation of new environments without duplicating data.
